title: 'I donâ€™t want to go to heaven': Ohio girl pleads with father not to kill her during standoff with cops in chilling audio
content: A distressing audio of seven-year-old Oaklynn Alexander pleading with her father during a police standoff in Ohio has gone viral. Her non-custodial father, Charles Ryan Alexander, kidnapped her, leading to a tense situation where he threatened both their lives. Police intervened, resulting in his death but Oaklynn's safe recovery.
summary: A distressing audio of seven-year-old Oaklynn Alexander pleading with her father during a police standoff in Ohio has gone viral. Her non-custodial father, Charles Ryan Alexander, kidnapped her, leading to a tense situation where he threatened both their lives. Police intervened, resulting in his death but Oaklynn's safe recovery.

title: Belgium loses case against women taken from mothers in colonial era
content: The Belgian state was ordered to compensate five mixed-race women who were forcibly placed in an orphanage 70 years ago under a colonial-era practice. The court deemed the abductions a crime against humanity. This ruling marks a historic first for colonial-era reparation cases.
summary: The Belgian state was ordered to compensate five mixed-race women who were forcibly placed in an orphanage 70 years ago under a colonial-era practice. The court deemed the abductions a crime against humanity. This ruling marks a historic first for colonial-era reparation cases.

title: Who is Hallie Olivere who found brother-in-law and ex Hunter Biden's gun in 2018?
content: In October 2018, Hallie Biden found a gun in Hunter Biden's truck. She panicked and discarded the gun in a trash can near a grocery store that had CCTV cameras. Police found the gun and it was traced back to Hunter Biden. Hallie and Hunter were in a relationship at that time as both of them were coping with Beau Biden's death. Hallie said Hunter introduced her to drugs.
summary: In October 2018, Hallie Biden found a gun in Hunter Biden's truck. She panicked and discarded the gun in a trash can near a grocery store that had CCTV cameras. Police found the gun and it was traced back to Hunter Biden. Hallie and Hunter were in a relationship at that time as both of them were coping with Beau Biden's death. Hallie said Hunter introduced her to drugs.

title: When Vivek Ramaswamy predicted Joe Biden would pardon son Hunter
content: In June, when Hunter Biden was convicted, Vivek Ramaswamy predicted that it was a farce and Joe Biden would definitely pardon him. At that time, Biden did not indicate that he would favor his son and save him from trial and following punishment. But on Sunday, in a surprising move, Biden pardoned his son Sunday saying that his son was treated differently as his political opponents pounced on him.
summary: In June, when Hunter Biden was convicted, Vivek Ramaswamy predicted that it was a farce and Joe Biden would definitely pardon him. At that time, Biden did not indicate that he would favor his son and save him from trial and following punishment. But on Sunday, in a surprising move, Biden pardoned his son Sunday saying that his son was treated differently as his political opponents pounced on him.

title: Bangladesh halves power imports from Adani after outstanding dues: Report
content: Bangladesh has halved its power imports from Adani Power due to reduced winter demand and disputes over $650 million in unpaid dues. Adani had already reduced supply after delayed payments, escalating the outstanding dues to $900 million. Power pricing differences and anti-India sentiment compound the issue.
summary: Bangladesh has halved its power imports from Adani Power due to reduced winter demand and disputes over $650 million in unpaid dues. Adani had already reduced supply after delayed payments, escalating the outstanding dues to $900 million. Power pricing differences and anti-India sentiment compound the issue.

title: Why Joe Biden pardoning his son Hunter is so controversial
content: President Joe Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter Biden, has led to significant controversy. It contradicts Biden's previous assurances against such a pardon, diverges from Justice Department clemency guidelines, raises ethical concerns regarding nepotism, and has sparked political backlash and renewed scrutiny of Biden's clemency record.
summary: President Joe Biden's pardon of his son, Hunter Biden, has led to significant controversy. It contradicts Biden's previous assurances against such a pardon, diverges from Justice Department clemency guidelines, raises ethical concerns regarding nepotism, and has sparked political backlash and renewed scrutiny of Biden's clemency record.

title: Canada pulls refugee welcome mat, launches ads warning asylum claims hard
content: Canada, once a welcoming nation for refugees, is now cautioning asylum-seekers through a $250,000 global online ad campaign that making a claim is difficult and has strict guidelines.
summary: Canada, once a welcoming nation for refugees, is now cautioning asylum-seekers through a $250,000 global online ad campaign that making a claim is difficult and has strict guidelines.

title: Fall of Aleppo: Who are Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, jihadist group behind resurgence of Syria conflict?
content: Recently, Syrian rebels launched a major offensive in Aleppo, seizing parts of the city and pushing south towards Hama. This prompted the first Russian airstrikes on Aleppo since 2016. The operation was led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), reviving conflict amidst new geopolitical dynamics and challenges faced by Assad's allies.
summary: Recently, Syrian rebels launched a major offensive in Aleppo, seizing parts of the city and pushing south towards Hama. This prompted the first Russian airstrikes on Aleppo since 2016. The operation was led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), reviving conflict amidst new geopolitical dynamics and challenges faced by Assad's allies.

title: Landmark climate change case opens at top UN court as island nations fear rising seas
content: The top UN court has commenced hearings on the legal responsibilities of countries to combat climate change and assist vulnerable nations. The case, pushed by island nations facing rising sea levels, seeks to establish international legal obligations and consequences for actions affecting the climate, with input from 99 countries and various organizations.
summary: The top UN court has commenced hearings on the legal responsibilities of countries to combat climate change and assist vulnerable nations. The case, pushed by island nations facing rising sea levels, seeks to establish international legal obligations and consequences for actions affecting the climate, with input from 99 countries and various organizations.

title: Mystery of repeating radio waves solved, scientists trace origin of slow radio pulses
content: Astronomers have pinpointed the source of slow, repeating radio bursts from space to a red dwarf star likely orbiting a white dwarf. These unusual signals, discovered in 2022, challenge existing theories about how pulsars emit radio waves and stem from interactions between the red dwarf's stellar wind and the white dwarf's magnetic field.
summary: Astronomers have pinpointed the source of slow, repeating radio bursts from space to a red dwarf star likely orbiting a white dwarf. These unusual signals, discovered in 2022, challenge existing theories about how pulsars emit radio waves and stem from interactions between the red dwarf's stellar wind and the white dwarf's magnetic field.

title: 'You guys are f**king crazy': Woman insults Indian-American family, caught on camera
content: A woman was captured on video being racist towards Pervez Taufiq and his Indian American family during a United Airlines transfer bus ride in Los Angeles. The incident followed her alleged harassment of Taufiqâ€™s son during their flight. United Airlines staff intervened after bystanders confirmed her as the aggressor, leading to her removal from the bus.

title: Hunter vows to make 'amends and rebuild lives' after father Joe Biden pardons him
content: Hunter Biden, after receiving a presidential pardon from his father Joe Biden, expressed remorse for past mistakes during his addiction struggles. Highlighting his five-year sobriety, he committed to helping others with addiction. The pardon, defended by President Biden, sparked varied reactions amidst political accusations.
summary: Hunter Biden, after receiving a presidential pardon from his father Joe Biden, expressed remorse for past mistakes during his addiction struggles. Highlighting his five-year sobriety, he committed to helping others with addiction. The pardon, defended by President Biden, sparked varied reactions amidst political accusations.

title: Watch: Trump's 'Health Czar' RFK Jr seen working out at gym for 'confirmation hearing', netizens react
content: US President-elect Donald Trump's appointment of Robert F Kennedy Jr to lead the Department of Health and Human Services has generated significant attention. Kennedy's plans include tackling chronic diseases, reducing corporate influence, and reforming the FDA. Known for his controversial views on vaccines, his nomination promises substantial changes in US health policies and practices.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump's appointment of Robert F Kennedy Jr to lead the Department of Health and Human Services has generated significant attention. Kennedy's plans include tackling chronic diseases, reducing corporate influence, and reforming the FDA. Known for his controversial views on vaccines, his nomination promises substantial changes in US health policies and practices.

title: 'What worked in Wisconsin can work nationwide': Ben Wikler joins DNC chair race after 2024 defeat
content: Wisconsin Democratic Party Chair Ben Wikler announced his candidacy for DNC chair to guide the party following the 2024 election victory by Republicans and Donald Trump. Wikler emphasizes year-round organization in various regions, citing successes in Wisconsin such as flipping the state Supreme Court majority and re-electing Governor Tony Evers, aiming to replicate these achievements nationally.
summary: Wisconsin Democratic Party Chair Ben Wikler announced his candidacy for DNC chair to guide the party following the 2024 election victory by Republicans and Donald Trump. Wikler emphasizes year-round organization in various regions, citing successes in Wisconsin such as flipping the state Supreme Court majority and re-electing Governor Tony Evers, aiming to replicate these achievements nationally.

title: Georgia protest enters fourth night of clash after suspension of EU talks: What we know so far
content: Protests in Georgia continue for a fourth night, sparked by the suspension of EU membership talks, leading to confrontations between police and demonstrators across the country. Critics allege the government is leaning towards authoritarianism and closer ties with Russia. The unrest has resulted in injuries and hospitalizations among protesters, police, and a media worker.
summary: Protests in Georgia continue for a fourth night, sparked by the suspension of EU membership talks, leading to confrontations between police and demonstrators across the country. Critics allege the government is leaning towards authoritarianism and closer ties with Russia. The unrest has resulted in injuries and hospitalizations among protesters, police, and a media worker.

title: 'Who stole his phone?': Bernie Sanders backs Trump's DOGE initiative, Elon Musk, netizens react
content: Senator Bernie Sanders endorsed President-elect Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) initiative targeting Pentagon spending. He expressed concern over the Pentagon's $886 billion budget and audit failures. Sanders emphasized the necessity for change in federal and defense spending, highlighting that only 13 senators opposed the defense budget last year.
summary: Senator Bernie Sanders endorsed President-elect Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) initiative targeting Pentagon spending. He expressed concern over the Pentagon's $886 billion budget and audit failures. Sanders emphasized the necessity for change in federal and defense spending, highlighting that only 13 senators opposed the defense budget last year.

title: Prince William was jealous of Harry before his wedding: Report
content: Prince Harry revealed his brother, Prince William, was envious of his beard during Harry's wedding to Meghan. Despite military protocol, Harry received permission from the Queen to keep his beard, sparking a week-long quarrel between the brothers. The rule has since been amended, and William now sports a beard with approval.
summary: Prince Harry revealed his brother, Prince William, was envious of his beard during Harry's wedding to Meghan. Despite military protocol, Harry received permission from the Queen to keep his beard, sparking a week-long quarrel between the brothers. The rule has since been amended, and William now sports a beard with approval.

title: 'Miscarriage of justice': Trump slams Biden's presidential pardon for son Hunter
content: US President-elect Donald Trump criticized outgoing President Joe Biden's decision to pardon Hunter Biden for gun crimes and tax violations, labeling it a miscarriage of justice. Biden defended the pardon, stating the charges were politically motivated. Trump's reaction hints at possible pardons for January 6 rioters once he takes office.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump criticized outgoing President Joe Biden's decision to pardon Hunter Biden for gun crimes and tax violations, labeling it a miscarriage of justice. Biden defended the pardon, stating the charges were politically motivated. Trump's reaction hints at possible pardons for January 6 rioters once he takes office.

title: Oxford's word of the year is 'brain rot'. What it means
content: Oxford's word of the year for 2024 is 'brain rot', highlighting concerns over excessive social media use and low-quality content. With over 37,000 votes, it reflects fears of declining mental capacity from trivial online material. The term, originating in 1854, gained popularity among Gen Z and Gen Alpha. Other shortlisted terms included 'demure', 'dynamic pricing', and 'slop'.
summary: Oxford's word of the year for 2024 is 'brain rot', highlighting concerns over excessive social media use and low-quality content. With over 37,000 votes, it reflects fears of declining mental capacity from trivial online material. The term, originating in 1854, gained popularity among Gen Z and Gen Alpha. Other shortlisted terms included 'demure', 'dynamic pricing', and 'slop'.
